October 20, 1954
Mr. Milton E. Krents
Director Radio and Television
The American Jewish Committee
386 Fourth Avenue
New York 16, New York
Dear Mr. Krentsi
I am very happy to inform you officially that the Board of Directors of the NAEB
has approved your application in behalf of the American Jewish Committee for
affiliate membership in our association.
You will now be receiving regularly from us the monthly NAEB Newsletter, various
additional publications of interest as they are published, and many other items.
You should of course feel free to write to us at any time for any information
you would like concerning educational broadcasting. We will always try to help.
Enclosed you will find a list of the materials available from the NAEB. Please
let us know which of these you would like to receive and we will send them to
you. Under separate cover we are sending you a Directory of Members. Your certi¬
ficate of membership will be sent to you soon.
Perhaps the greatest good of an NAEB membership is the associations you form, it*
good to know that others are having the same problems you are and how they are
solving them. It has been the tradition with NAEB, in its thirty years as the
association of educators who broadcast, to exchange this sort of information on a
friend-to-friend basis. You will find lots of friends in the NAEB, and lots of
people with good advice and good staff resources to supplement those which you
have.
Sincerely,
Harry J. Skoraia
Executive Director
HJSirtb
ere.
